result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary E McDowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mary E McDowell
Current: 3701 W. Oklahoma Ave. Apt 5, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 3620 W. Kilbourn Avene #6, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $372.00 entered as ordered by the court on 02/01/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 11/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Filed:  signed Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs and supporting documents.

*forwarded to Clerk of Circuit Courts Room 104CH for processing*

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 4 (four) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by July 6, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.

-20 day appeal given,
-
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant  has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause by her next birthday on May 3, 2016. 
.
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Mary E McDowell
Current: 3620 W. Kilbourn Avene #6, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 01-06-2016)
Prior: 3312 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Mary E McDowell in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Mary E McDowell in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Joseph Domask to represent the defendant; Attorney Domask to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 2/1/2016.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept.  Order signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary E McDowell in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not eligible for PD representation.  Court gives defendant additional time to obtain private counsel.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mary E McDowell in court. Matt Adrian appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 09-23-2015 at 01:30pm
